page.title: 17Portex continued
page.content: As the things{Portex}make are all medical supplies, they obviously have to be sterile, therefore the conditions at Portex are different from a normal factory. The people have to wear special clothing. The first thing they do is put on a hat and tuck their hair in, then coverings for their shoes and then a long gown gathered at the wrists and neck. They must not wear any make-up, or perfume and no jewellery apart from gold rings. Throughout the 1970's Portex strenghthened its position in world markets and the company's export achievements were recognised by gaining the{Queen' Award for Export three times during that decade. In 1979 Portex also won the{Queen's Award {for Technological Achievement.
